title: Wychmere Beach Club on Cape Cod files a new redevelopment plan
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel The new plan calls for a reduced design.
Old Snow Inn in Harwich Port.
Wychmere Beach Club Wychmere Beach Club in Harwich has submitted a new redevelopment proposal after withdrawing a previous application due to community concerns.

title: Woman dies after being rescued from island off Cape Cod following boat fire
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Cynthia Sullivan, her son, and her husband escaped to Naushon Island after their boat went up in flames this week.
Cynthia and Patrick Sullivan.
GoFundMe A woman who escaped a burning boat and was rescued from an island off Cape Cod this week has died.

title: ‘A handshake between the centuries’: Delamar Mystic now open in Connecticut
author: Nathan Tavares
bullets: Travel A new hotel has opened in Mystic, Connecticut, where guests can enjoy the beautiful design on the Mystic River.
The exterior of the new Delamar Mystic (Julie Bidwell).

title: Patriots owner Robert Kraft nominated for induction into Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Kraft is one of seven members from the Patriots' dynasty era to be nominated for induction into the Pro Football Hall of Fame this week.
Robert Kraft has helped the Patriots win six Super Bowl titles after buying the team in 1994.

(AP Photo/Maria Lysaker, File) By Conor Roche October 24, 2025 | 1:37 PM 2 minutes to read There’s a chance Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft could be inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame together next summer.

title: Review & setlist: Neko Case stuns with casual vocal brilliance at The Wilbur
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Concert Reviews Overheard among the crowd leaving the Neko Case concert Thursday night: “She’s got some pipes!
” Neko Case at MASS MoCA in 2022.
She brought her band to The Wilbur Thursday in support of her new album, "Neon Grey Midnight Green.

title: Reported shooting in Cambridge prompts brief shelter-in-place order at Harvard
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Local News There aren't any known victims or concerns about public safety risk at this time, a spokesman for Cambridge police said.
Cambridge police released these photos of a person of interest in Friday's reported shooting incident.
Police clarified that this person is not wanted at this time, but detectives would like to speak with them.

title: Jewish groups seek answers after Rhode Island high school football players in antisemitic hazing case reinstated
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The superintendent reversed season-long suspensions for five players accused of taking part in what the advocacy groups called “a horrific antisemitic hazing attack.

” Two Jewish advocacy groups are demanding answers after Smithfield, Rhode Island, school officials reinstated several football players accused of taking part in what they called a “horrific antisemitic hazing attack.

”In a joint statement Thursday, the Jewish Alliance for Greater Rhode Island and the Sandra Bornstein Holocaust Education Center condemned the district’s decision to let the players return, calling it a betrayal of the community’s trust and a setback in the fight against antisemitism.

title: Mike Vrabel is not falling into the trap of comparing Drake Maye to Tom Brady
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Morning Sports Update "He's got a lot of years to go.
" Drake Maye and Mike Vrabel have helped the Patriots get out to a 5-2 start this season.
(Winslow Townson/AP Images for Panini) By Conor Roche October 24, 2025 | 11:19 AM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: The second best spirits tasting room in America is in New England, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel You'll find it in Vermont.
Bourbon at Smugglers' Notch Distillery in Jeffersonville, Vermont.
Craig Orsini By Kristi Palma October 24, 2025 | 11:10 AM 1 minute to read A spirits tasting room in Vermont narrowly missed being named the best in the nation.

title: Boston’s Patricia Cornwell talks hybrid monkeys, AI, and Nicole Kidman ahead of Boston Book Fest
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Books Cornwell’s new thriller is on shelves now — and “Scarpetta” will soon stream starring Kidman, Jamie Lee Curtis and Bobby Cannavale.
Handout By Lauren Daley October 24, 2025 | 10:38 AM 8 minutes to read Whenever I talk to Boston’s Patricia Cornwell, that Jack Kerouac line pops into my head.
She never yawns or says a commonplace thing.
